page.title: 18How Nuneaton has changed (1)
page.content:
My Nan has known Nuneaton for 60 years.
The Newdigate Arms Hotel was like an entrance into the town.The streets were narrower and Abbey Street was houses instead of the shops of today. All of the shops were much smaller. W.H.Smiths was where Debenhams is now and instead of the large Co-op there were small,individual shops.Next to the Co-op was the Gas Works.This has now been demolished and became the first car park in the town centre, although you could park your car wherever you wanted to then. There was a chapel at the corner of Stratford Street and Abbey Street,and the Fire Station and Library were next to each other in Queens Road.
